author: Kaye Federspiel
content:
Need to increase my fat intake and just can't come up with ideas.  Thoughts on what you eat
37 comments
Breanna Joy Cuevas
I cook in a lot of tallow or butter or bacon grease. I use a spatula to get every bit onto my plate, dip every bite of steak and then lick my plate when I’m done.

replies.content: Browned butter bites
Penny Atherton I second this!
Eat higher fat meat cuts

Muriah Cardin 100% this! There's so many varieties of cuts of meat on the animal there's no reason why anyone is not getting tjeir fat from their meat choices! Choose Cuts Like ribs especially lamb ribs are very fatty and quite healing actually, chuck … See more

Kaye Federspiel I follow an 80/20 split and I eat a lot of red meats (if it's a lower fat cut I will add grass-fed butter to increase the fat), we eat baby back ribs, rack of lamb, and lots of eggs cooked in grass-fed butter. Occasionally adding some raw cheese as well.
Yolks or egg pudding, a cup of heavy cream if you tolerate dairy, pork belly w taco seasoning!
Pork belly burnt ends.
Brown butter bites or butter.
Fattier steaks. What do you eat now? Why do you think you need to up your fats?
Smother everything in butter
Sardines, pork rinds, short ribs, high fat hamburger, ribeye, eggs, bacon. Cook with duck fat, lard, tallow, butter. Use heavy whipping cream. . . and more!
I have butter in my morning coffee, or just with hot water. And I have a large dollop with my steak. Always cook my eggs in butter as well. That seems to be enough for my body.
I've discovered crème fraîche. It's super tasty, cheap and no additives
Kaye Federspiel

replies.reply_by: Han van der Heide what is that?
replies.content: Han van der Heide what is that?

Kaye Federspiel it's like sour cream, but thicker. Has the consistency of thick pudding.
Cheap too, only one Euro for 200 ml. One cup has 60 grams of milkfat and not much else
I just eat cold butter

Admin
Kaye Federspiel triglycerides are a type of fat that are the most abundant in the body. If you consume more energy than your body requires then it gets stored since your body doesn't need to use it for energy.

Kaye Federspiel if you eat way more fat than you need, your triglycerides are going to go up.
When I was doing high fat carnivore because "everybody" kept saying that was healthy, eating at a 2:1 ratio (2 gr of fat for every gram of protein) I gained… See more

Butter butter butter. I don't know how people can just eat a stick by itself. I can eat a few pats at a time. I just add it to everything as a dipping sauce. I can't handle the texture of fat on meat so it has to go. I sometimes add egg yolk to… See more
